label: AB_mC32_12_4i_4i-001
title: $\alpha$-BiI Structure
comments: BiI occurs naturally in three phases, with high pressure phases predicted to occur (Deng, 2019).  All of the natural phases are in space group $C2/m$ \#12, with atoms on the (4i) Wyckoff positions.  The only difference between the structures is the stacking of the atoms. \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_mC32_12_4i_4i-001}{$\alpha$-BiI} (this structure) is the ground state structure. \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_mC16_12_2i_2i-002}{$\beta$-BiI} is metastable at room temperature and stable above 564K. \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_mC16_12_2i_2i-003}{$\gamma$-BiI} is formed at 580K. \end{itemize}
